Research Interests

Design of data-driven models that respect physical constraints/information
Stochastic representations of model error/discrepancy/inadequacy
Probabilistic graphical models and sparsity of Markov random fields
Calibration, validation, and uncertainty quantification for predictive models
Bayesian probability as a logical framework and causal probability

Current research collaborators

Clayton Lewis, Professor, Computer Science.
Youssef Marzouk, Professor, MIT.
